Aberrant (Bloodline).name: Aberrant (Bloodline)
Aberrant (Bloodline).description:
A bizarre and alien legacy taints the sorcerer’s blood. Her strange form increases her Toughness by +1. @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Bolt]{Bolt}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Blast]{blast}, and @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Burst]{burst} spells must be cast with the Lingering Damage @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Power Modifier}, but cost the sorcerer only 1 additional @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Power Points]{Power Point} instead of 2.

Finally, her long limbs give her Reach +1. In addition to allowing the sorcerer to attack at a distance, this can be used for determining a spell’s Range or origin.

  • Advanced Form: The character is never @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Surprised} and is immune to @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{the Drop} unless @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Bound}. Her alien form grants her another point of Toughness.

Aberration (Type).name: Aberration (Type)
Aberration (Type).description: Rare creatures with bizarre anatomy, strange abilities, or other alien characteristics.

Abjuration (Favored).name: Abjuration (Favored)
Abjuration (Favored).description:
Specialists must choose one favored school and two opposition schools from the list @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05schoolsofmag00]{here}. They gain a free reroll on arcane skill rolls to cast spells (not activating an item) from their favored school, but spells cast from their opposition school cost one additional Power Point and suffer a −2 penalty to the wizard's arcane skill roll.
Wizards mark opposition spells in their power lists with an asterisk, like this: banish*.

This is the school of protective magic. It's used to prevent harm and suppress other spells. @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Arcane Protection]{Arcane protection}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Banish]{banish}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Damage Field]{damage field}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Dispel]{dispel}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Deflection]{deflection}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Protection]{protection}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Sanctuary]{sanctuary}.

@UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05schoolsofmag00]{See Schools of Magic for more}.

Abjuration (Opposition).name: Abjuration (Opposition)
Abjuration (Opposition).description:
Specialists must choose one favored school and two opposition schools from the list @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05schoolsofmag00]{here}. They gain a free reroll on arcane skill rolls to cast spells (not activating an item) from their favored school, but spells cast from their opposition school cost one additional Power Point and suffer a −2 penalty to the wizard's arcane skill roll.
Wizards mark opposition spells in their power lists with an asterisk, like this: banish*.

This is the school of protective magic. It's used to prevent harm and suppress other spells. @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Arcane Protection]{Arcane protection}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Banish]{banish}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Damage Field]{damage field}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Dispel]{dispel}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Deflection]{deflection}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Protection]{protection}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Sanctuary]{sanctuary}.

@UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05schoolsofmag00]{See Schools of Magic for more}.

Abyssal (Bloodline).name: Abyssal (Bloodline)
Abyssal (Bloodline).description:
Generations ago, a demon corrupted the hero’s heritage. She has environmental resistance to electricity, +1 Toughness, and sharp claws that cause Str+d4 damage.

  • Advanced Form: The abyssal can conjure demons to aid her. The cost for @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Summon Ally]{summon ally} is reduced by 2 (to a minimum of 1), and the entities summoned cause @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04fear0000000000]{Fear}. She also gains @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Environmental Resistance]{environmental resistance} to cold and fire.

Adaptability.name: Adaptability
Adaptability.description: • Adaptability: Humans start with a free @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01edges000000000]{Edge} (they must meet the requirements, as usual). They also gain a d6 in any one @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Attribute} instead of a d4. This does not increase the attribute limit.

Agile.name: Agile
Agile.description: • Agile: Elves are graceful and agile. They start with a d6 in @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Agility} instead of a d4. This increases maximum Agility to d12+1.

All-Around Vision.name: All-Around Vision
All-Around Vision.description: A few creatures possess the remarkable ability to see in all directions, usually because of unique physical features. Creatures with All-Around Vision ignore one point of @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Gang Up} bonuses, add +2 to @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Notice]{Notice} rolls made to resist attacks from @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Stealth]{Stealth}, and cannot be the target of a Sneak Attack.

Ancestry.name: Ancestry
Ancestry.description:
Many humanoids have universal features common to their ancestry. These include special @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000001]{abilities}, @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01edges000000000]{Edges}, and @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01hindrances0000]{Hindrances}. Goblins have @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Darkvision]{Darkvision}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Size]{Size} −1, and @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-hindrances.Greedy]{Greedy} (Major), for example. Some non-humanoids and other creature types may also have a universal set of features— such as archons, demons, and devils— when there are different versions within a creature category.

Instead of listing each of these features separately, they are listed together in one bullet in the creature’s stat block, such as “Ancestry (Goblin)” or “Archons.”

Animal (Type).name: Animal (Type)
Animal (Type).description: Any living vertebrate creature with no magical abilities and no innate language or culture. Smarts is relative to the animal world, as indicated by the (A) as a reminder of “animal intelligence.”

Aquatic.name: Aquatic
Aquatic.description: The creature is native to the water. It is a natural swimmer and cannot drown. Its @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Pace} in water is specified after the Aquatic ability.

Arcane (Bloodline).name: Arcane (Bloodline)
Arcane (Bloodline).description:
The sorcerer forms a magical bond with a creature or an object. Use the rules for the wizard’s @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Wizard]{Arcane Bond}.

  • Advanced Form: The sorcerer’s connection to magic is incredibly strong. She gets a free @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{reroll} on any failed @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Spellcasting]{Spellcasting} roll.

Arcane Background (Cleric).name: Arcane Background (Cleric)
Arcane Background (Cleric).description:
Arcane Background (Cleric): Clerics use @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Faith]{Faith} as their arcane skill. On taking this Edge, a character gains 10 Power Points and must choose a Domain for the deity she serves from the list below. All clerics start with the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Healing]{healing} power and two other powers from their available powers.

Available Powers: Clerics have access to powers from the list below plus the powers listed for their chosen Domain: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Banish]{banish}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Boost/Lower Trait]{boost/lower trait}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Conjure Item]{conjure item}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Darksight]{darksight}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Dispel]{dispel}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Divination]{divination}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Empathy]{empathy}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Healing]{healing}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Light / Darkness]{light/darkness}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Relief]{relief}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Resurrection]{resurrection}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Sanctuary]{sanctuary}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Slumber]{slumber}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Smite]{smite}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Sound/Silence]{sound/silence}.

Arcane Bond.name: Arcane Bond
Arcane Bond.description:
Arcane Bond

Wizards immerse themselves in the study of eldritch lore and arcane theories. During these long hours they form a bond with a dependable item or friendly creature (a “familiar”). Choose one of the following options for your wizard:

  • Bonded Object: The spellcaster possesses an amulet, ring, staff, wand, or weapon that adds +1 to all his Spellcasting totals when worn or in hand. If the object is lost or destroyed, the mage can replace it with a new object worth at least 500 gp.
  • Familiar: The mage has a magical pet. See the sidebar below.

Arcane School.name: Arcane School
Arcane School.description:
School: A wizard’s studies lead him down one of two paths— the “universalist” who dabbles in all the various “schools” of magic, or a “specialist” who focuses on one school at the expense of some others.
Specialists must choose one favored school and two opposition schools from the list @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05schoolsofmag00]{here}. They gain a free reroll on arcane skill rolls to cast spells (not activating an item) from their favored school, but spells cast from their opposition school cost one additional Power Point and suffer a −2 penalty to the wizard's arcane skill roll.
Wizards mark opposition spells in their power lists with an asterisk, like this: banish*.

Armor.name: Armor
Armor.description: A creature’s Armor is written in parentheses next to its total Toughness, and already added in. Thick, leathery hide generally offers 2 points of @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02armor000000000]{Armor}. Creatures like a stegosaurus generally have 4 or more points of protection. Supernatural creatures may have much higher Armor values. A living statue, for example, might have 8 points of Armor or more.

Armor Interference (Bard).name: Armor Interference (Bard)
Armor Interference (Bard).description: Armor Interference (Light): Bulky armor interferes with a bard’s grace and dexterity. They subtract 4 from their Performance rolls and from their Agility and Agility-based skill rolls if using medium or heavy armor or shields.

Armor Interference (Druid).name: Armor Interference (Druid)
Armor Interference (Druid).description: Armor Interference (Light): Bulky armor interferes with a druid’s ability to sense and commune with nature. They subtract 4 from their Faith rolls and from their Agility and Agility-based skill rolls if using medium or heavy armor or shields. Druids cannot use metal armor at all.

Armor Interference (Wizard).name: Armor Interference (Wizard)
Armor Interference (Wizard).description: Armor Interference (Any): Like sorcerers, wizards must gesticulate in precise patterns. They subtract 4 from their Spellcasting rolls and from their Agility and Agility-based skill rolls if using light, medium, or heavy armor or shields.

Armor Restriction (Barbarian).name: Armor Restriction (Barbarian)
Armor Restriction (Barbarian).description: Armor Restriction (Medium): A barbarian’s fighting style requires great freedom of movement. They subtract 4 from Agility and Agility-based skill rolls when wearing heavy armor or using a heavy shield.

Armor Restriction (Monk).name: Armor Restriction (Monk)
Armor Restriction (Monk).description: Armor Restriction (Any): Monks must be completely unhindered to perform their complex maneuvers. They subtract 4 from Agility and Agility-based skill rolls if using light, medium, or heavy armor or shields.

Armor Restriction (Ranger).name: Armor Restriction (Ranger)
Armor Restriction (Ranger).description: Armor Restriction (Medium): Rangers are agile and mobile fighters and scouts. They subtract 4 from Agility and Agility-based skill rolls when wearing heavy armor or using a heavy shield.

Armor Restriction (Rogue).name: Armor Restriction (Rogue)
Armor Restriction (Rogue).description: Armor Restriction (Light): Rogues are nimble and deadly acrobats. Bulky armor interferes with their abilities, so they subtract 4 from Agility and Agility-based skill rolls when wearing medium or heavy armor, or using medium or heavy shields.

Armor Restriction (Sorcerer).name: Armor Restriction (Sorcerer)
Armor Restriction (Sorcerer).description: Armor Interference (Any): Sorcery requires rapid, intricate, and unhindered somatic movements. Sorcerers subtract 4 from their Spellcasting rolls and from their Agility and Agility-based skill rolls if using light, medium, or heavy armor or shields.

Aura of Courage.name: Aura of Courage
Aura of Courage.description: Aura of Courage: As long as the paladin is conscious, all allies within 10” (20 yards) add +1 to their Fear checks.

Bash.name: Bash
Bash.description: Larger creatures often use their bodies or body parts to pummel their opponents during combat. See the creature’s statistics for any special effects.

Blindsense.name: Blindsense
Blindsense.description: A creature with this ability can perceive its environment using non-visual senses. This includes a keen sense of smell, echolocation, or sensing vibrations in the ground or even in the air. These creatures ignore @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Invisibility]{invisibility}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Illusion]{illusion}, and all @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Illumination} penalties.

Bloodline.name: Bloodline
Bloodline.description: Bloodline: The sorcerer must choose a bloodline. Beneath each Bloodline description is also the additional special ability one gains when taking the Advanced Bloodline Edge.

Breath Weapons.name: Breath Weapons
Breath Weapons.description:
Most dragons and other “fire breathers” use a Cone Template for their attacks (see @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Area Effect} attacks). A few specific creatures, such as blue and black dragons, use the Stream Template.

All breath attacks may be Evaded (see @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Evasion}).

Unless the creature’s description says otherwise, breath attacks take the creature’s entire turn— they can’t perform @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Multi-Actions} in the same round they make a breath attack.

Burrow.name: Burrow
Burrow.description:
From massive worms to sand-dwelling humanoids, many creatures are able to burrow beneath the earth and move within it.

Burrowers can tunnel underground and reappear elsewhere for devastating surprise attacks against their foes. The distance a creature can burrow on its turn is written immediately after its Burrow ability.

A burrowing creature may tunnel as an action, and may erupt from the ground at any point within its burrowing @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Pace} in the same turn. It cannot be attacked while beneath the earth unless the attacker has some special means of detecting it and penetrating the intervening dirt.

Burrowing creatures erupt from beneath their opponents and may take them by @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{surprise}. If the target was unaware of the burrower’s presence, the creature makes an @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{opposed} @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Stealth]{Stealth} roll versus the victim’s @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Notice]{Notice}. If the burrower wins, the target is @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Vulnerable} to it only. With a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise}, the burrower gets @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{the drop}. Targets on @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Hold} may attempt to interrupt the attack before it occurs.

Burrowers can’t usually surprise a foe once their presence is known, but can still burrow for protection and mobility.

Celestial (Bloodline).name: Celestial (Bloodline)
Celestial (Bloodline).description:
A celestial ancestor or divine intervention of some sort blessed this hero’s bloodline. Her @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Bolt]{bolt}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Blast]{blast}, and @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Burst]{burst} spells cause +2 damage to evil creatures (this stacks with Champion, see @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01edgesummarie00]{Weird Edges}). She also gains @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Environmental Resistance]{environmental resistance} to cold and acid.

  • Advanced Form: The celestial can extend or hide angel-like wings as a free action. While extended, she gains @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Flight]{Flight} at @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Pace} 12.

Channel Energy.name: Channel Energy
Channel Energy.description: Channel Energy: Clerics can cast the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Healing]{healing} power at a Range of Spirit rather than Touch. Their healing power also has the Additional Recipients Power Modifier, allowing them to heal nearby allies at the cost of one extra Power Point each.

Civilization (Community, Nobility).name: Civilization (Community, Nobility)
Civilization (Community, Nobility).description:
• Aspects: Cities, towns, legacy, linage
  • Deities: Abadar, Erastil
  • Available Powers: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Barrier]{Barrier}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Disguise]{disguise}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Environmental Protection]{environmental protection}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Locate]{locate}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Mind Link]{mind link}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Protection]{protection}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Puppet]{puppet}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Speak Language]{speak language}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Summon Ally]{summon ally}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Warrior's Gift]{warrior's gift}.

Class Abilities.name: Class Abilities
Class Abilities.description: When a creature has a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01edgesummarie00]{Class Edge}, the specific features of the Edge are listed in a single bullet. A goblin warchanter, for example, has the Bard Class Edge, with all its features listed in a single bullet labeled “Class Abilities (Bard).”

Conjuration (Favored).name: Conjuration (Favored)
Conjuration (Favored).description:
Specialists must choose one favored school and two opposition schools from the list @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05schoolsofmag00]{here}. They gain a free reroll on arcane skill rolls to cast spells (not activating an item) from their favored school, but spells cast from their opposition school cost one additional Power Point and suffer a −2 penalty to the wizard's arcane skill roll.
Wizards mark opposition spells in their power lists with an asterisk, like this: banish*.

This school focuses on altering reality by creating, restoring or moving objects and creatures. @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Barrier]{Barrier}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Burrow]{burrow}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Conjure Item]{conjure item}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Healing]{healing}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Planar Binding]{planar binding}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Plane Shift]{plane shift}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Relief]{relief}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Resurrection]{resurrection}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Summon Ally]{summon ally}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Teleport]{teleport}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Warrior's Gift]{warrior’s gift}.

@UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05schoolsofmag00]{See Schools of Magic for more}.

Conjuration (Opposition).name: Conjuration (Opposition)
Conjuration (Opposition).description:
Specialists must choose one favored school and two opposition schools from the list @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05schoolsofmag00]{here}. They gain a free reroll on arcane skill rolls to cast spells (not activating an item) from their favored school, but spells cast from their opposition school cost one additional Power Point and suffer a −2 penalty to the wizard's arcane skill roll.
Wizards mark opposition spells in their power lists with an asterisk, like this: banish*.

This school focuses on altering reality by creating, restoring or moving objects and creatures. @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Barrier]{Barrier}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Burrow]{burrow}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Conjure Item]{conjure item}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Healing]{healing}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Planar Binding]{planar binding}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Plane Shift]{plane shift}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Relief]{relief}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Resurrection]{resurrection}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Summon Ally]{summon ally}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Teleport]{teleport}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Warrior's Gift]{warrior’s gift}.

@UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05schoolsofmag00]{See Schools of Magic for more}.

Construct.name: Construct
Construct.description:
Golems and other animated objects are collectively called “constructs.” Some are sentient beings while others are mere automatons following the will of their masters.

Whatever their origin or material, constructs have several inherent advantages over creatures of flesh and blood.

Constructs add +2 when attempting to recover from being @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Shaken}, ignore 1 point of Wound penalties, don’t breathe or eat and are immune to @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{disease} and @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{poison}, don’t @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03healing0000000]{Bleed Out}, and @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wounds} are removed with @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Repair]{Repair} instead of @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Healing]{Healing} with no @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03healing0000000]{"Golden Hour"}

Construct (Type).name: Construct (Type)
Construct (Type).description: An artificially created object or creature.

Damage.name: Damage
Damage.description:
After a successful melee or ranged hit, the attacker rolls damage. Ranged weapons do fixed damage as listed in the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gearnotes00000]{Gear} section. Most pistols, for example, cause 2d6 damage.

Hand weapons cause damage equal to the attacker’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Strength} die plus a second die, which depends on the weapon. A barbarian with a d12 Strength and a long sword (d8 damage) rolls d12+d8 damage.

Even though Strength is used to determine melee damage, this isn’t a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Trait} roll so @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03wildcardsand00]{Wild Cards} don’t add a Wild Die to the roll.

All damage rolls can Ace.

Unarmed Damage: An unarmed combatant rolls only his Strength die unless he has an @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01edges000000000]{Edge} like @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Brawler]{Brawler} or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Martial Artist]{Martial Artist} that grants him a damage die.

Bonus Damage

Well-placed attacks are more likely to hit vital areas, and so do more damage. If your hero gets a raise on his attack roll (regardless of how many raises), he adds +1d6 to the final total. Bonus dice can also Ace!

Bonus damage applies to all attacks, including @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{spells} and @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03areaeffectat00]{area effect} weapons.

Applying Damage

If the damage roll is less than the target’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01characters0000]{Toughness}, the victim is beaten up a bit but there’s no game effect. If the damage is equal to or greater than his Toughness, he’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03damageeffect00]{Shaken}. Each raise on the damage roll also inflicts a  @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03damageeffect00]{Wound}:

  • SUCCESS: The character is Shaken. If he was already Shaken and the second result is from physical damage of some kind (not a Test that results in Shaken, for example), he remains Shaken and takes a Wound.
  • Raise: The character suffers a Wound for every raise on the damage roll, and is Shaken.

Darkvision.name: Darkvision
Darkvision.description: Some creatures on Golarion possess the extraordinary ability to see without a light source. Creatures with this ability ignore penalties for @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Illumination} up to 10″ (20 yards).

Death.name: Death
Death.description:
• Aspects: Birth, fate, prophecy, repose
  • Deities: Norgorber, Pharasma, Urgathoa, Zon-Kuthon.
  • Available Powers: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Blind]{Blind}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Bolt]{bolt}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Curse]{curse}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Damage Field]{damage field}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Drain Power Points]{drain power points}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Fear]{fear}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Mind Wipe]{Mind Wipe}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Planar Binding]{planar binding}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Protection]{protection}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Zombie]{zombie} .

Destined (Bloodline).name: Destined (Bloodline)
Destined (Bloodline).description:
The character is destined for great things. She gains one additional @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Benny} per session.

  • Advanced Form: The hero starts with two extra Bennies per session.

Destruction (Evil, Madness).name: Destruction (Evil, Madness)
Destruction (Evil, Madness).description:
• Aspects: Destruction, hate, madness, violence
  • Deities: Asmodeus, Gorum, Lamashtu, Nethys, Norgorber, Rovagug, Urgathoa, Zon-Kuthon
  • Available Powers: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Bolt]{Bolt}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Confusion]{confusion}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Curse]{curse}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Damage Field]{damage field}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Deflection]{deflection}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Drain Power Points]{drain power points}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Fear]{fear}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Stun]{stun}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Summon Ally]{summon ally}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Zombie]{zombie}

Detect Evil.name: Detect Evil
Detect Evil.description: Detect Evil: As an action, the Paladin can concentrate on any one object or individual within Smarts range to determine whether it’s Evil in nature. See the Cleric section for deities and their alignments.

Disarm.name: Disarm
Disarm.description:
A character can try to make an opponent drop a weapon (or other object) or attempt to damage it, by making a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03attacks0000000]{melee or ranged attack}.

The attacker must first hit the object or the opponent’s limb or hand (see @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03calledshots000]{Called Shots})

If the attack hits the weapon, the attacker rolls damage normally for an item (no raise effect or Aces, see @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03breakingthin00]{Breaking Things}). The defender must make a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Strength} roll equal to the damage or drop the item.

If the attack is against the wielder and @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03damageeffect00]{Shakes or Wounds} him, the defender must make a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Strength} roll at −2 if it hit his limb, or −4 if it hit his hand, plus any Wound penalties that result as usual. Failure means he drops whatever item is in that hand.

Draconic (Bloodline).name: Draconic (Bloodline)
Draconic (Bloodline).description:
There’s a dragon lurking somewhere in the family tree. Its scion gains claws (Str+d4), scaly skin (Armor +2), and +1 damage to powers with @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{trappings} suitable to her draconic bloodline.

  • Advanced Form: The sorcerer’s claws now add @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{AP} +2 and she gains @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Environmental Resistance]{environmental resistance} common to her bloodline (acid for black, fire for red, etc.).

Dragon (Type).name: Dragon (Type)
Dragon (Type).description: The family of legendary magical reptilian creatures, usually winged.

Dwarf.name: Dwarf
Dwarf.description:
Dwarves are a stern and hardy folk, ensconced in cities carved from the hearts of mountains. A proud, warlike people, dwarves remain determined to repel the depredations of their ancestral enemies. They tolerate “frail” peoples, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Elf]{(elves}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Gnome]{gnomes} and @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Halfling]{halflings}) while they often bond with @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Human]{humans}, whose industrious nature comes closest to dwarven ideals.

Short and stocky, dwarves stand a foot or two shorter than most humans. Male and female dwarves pride themselves on the length of their hair. Men often decorate their beards with clasps and intricate braids. A clean shaven male dwarf is a sure sign of madness.

Languages: Common and Dwarven.

Age Range: Adult 45, old age 188, max age 250-450.

Dwarf Males: Height 3'11-4'5 and weight 164-206 (Average 4'2" , 185 lbs).

Dwarf Females: Height: 3'9"-4'3" and weight 134-176 (Average 4'0", 165 lbs).

  • Darkvision: Dwarven eyes are accustomed to the dark of the underearth. Dwarves ignore penalties for @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Illumination} up to 10” (20 yards).
  • Iron constitution: Dwarves add +1 when resisting @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{poison}. They also add +1 when resisting or recovering from powers or abilities that state they work like a power.
  • Reduced Pace: Decrease the character’s @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Pace} by 1 and reduce the running die by one die type.
  • Stonecunning: Dwarves grow up in halls and caverns of worked stone, and get a @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Notice]{Notice} roll at +2 as a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{free action} within 10 feet of unusual stonework such as traps and hidden doors. Success means they know something is off, and a @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{raise} gives them more specific information such as how to trigger the trap or open the door.
  • Tough: Stout and tough, Dwarves start with a d6 in @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Vigor} instead of a d4. This increases maximum Vigor to d12+1. They treat their @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Strength} as one die type higher when determining @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02gear0000000000]{Encumbrance} and Minimum Strength to use armor and equipment without penalty (but not weapons). This ability stacks with the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-edges.Brawny]{Brawny} Edge if the dwarf has it.

Elemental.name: Elemental
Elemental.description:
Air, earth, fire, and water form the basis of the elemental realms, wherein dwell strange, unfathomable creatures.

Elementals have bodies of pure earth, water, air, or fire and are immune to damage, effects, or @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Trapping}s that match their native element. They also ignore additional damage from @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Called Shots}, ignore one point of @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wound} penalties, don’t breathe or eat, are immune to @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{disease} and @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{poison}, and can only be healed via magic or natural @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03healing0000000]{Healing}.

Elemental (Air, Earth, Fire, Water).name: Elemental (Air, Earth, Fire, Water)
Elemental (Air, Earth, Fire, Water).description:
• Aspects: Air, cold, earth, fire, heat, water
  • Deities: Abadar, Asmodeus, Gozreh, Pharasma, Sarenrae, Shelyn, Torag
  • Available Powers: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Barrier]{Barrier}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Blast]{blast}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Burrow]{burrow}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Burst]{burst}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Damage Field]{damage field}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Deflection]{deflection}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Elemental Manipulation]{elemental manipulation}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Environmental Protection]{environmental protection}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Havoc]{havoc}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Intangibility]{intangibility}.

Elemental (Bloodline).name: Elemental (Bloodline)
Elemental (Bloodline).description:
The mage’s family was touched by a powerful elemental force. Choose one of the elements listed below. Your hero gains @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Environmental Resistance]{environmental resistance} to that element and one of the following abilities:

  • Air: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Flight]{Flight}, @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Pace} 6.
  • Earth: Burrowing Pace 6 (see @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Burrow]{Burrow}).
  • Fire: +2 damage to damaging Powers with a fire @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Trapping}.
  • Water: Enemies are automatically @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powermodifie00]{Hindered} when affected by your powers.
  • Advanced Form: Once per encounter, you can unleash an elemental blast as an action. This causes 3d6 damage, uses the @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Cone Template}, and may be @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Evaded}.

Elf.name: Elf
Elf.description:
The long-lived elves are children of the natural world, superficially similar to fey creatures and yet distinct in important ways. Elves value their privacy and traditions. Although they are often slow to make friends, once an outsider is accepted as a comrade, such alliances can last for generations. Elves distrust @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Half-Orc]{half-orcs} and display a fascination with @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Human]{humans}, while remaining mostly indifferent to other peoples.

Elves are tall, thin souls with pointed ears and deep-set eyes of various colors. Whether they hail from the deep forests or hidden valleys, elves are born more graceful than humans, though somewhat slighter. Elves are known for their patience and affinity for magic.

Languages: Common and Elven.

Age Range: Adult 115, old age, 263, max age 350-750.

Elf Males: Height 5'6-6'8 and weight 116-158 (Average 6'1" , 127 lbs).

Elf Females: Height 5'6"-6'4" and weight 96-126 (Average 6'1", 117 lbs).

  • Agile: Elves are graceful and agile. They start with a d6 in @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Agility} instead of a d4. This increases maximum Agility to d12+1.
  • Elven Magic: Elves have an inherent connection to arcane energies. Elves get a free @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{reroll} when rolling to resist enemy powers.
  • Intelligence: Elves are highly intelligent and long-lived. They start with a d6 in @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Smarts} instead of a d4. This increases maximum Smarts to d12+1.
  • Keen Senses: Elves start with a d6 in @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-skills.Notice]{Notice} instead of a d4. This increases their maximum Notice to d12+1.
  • Low Light Vision: Elven eyes amplify light. Others often claim they can see stars in the elves’ eyes. They ignore penalties for Dim and Dark @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Illumination}.
  • Slender: Slight of build and less robust than others, elves suffer −1 Toughness and –1 to @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Vigor} rolls.

Elven Magic.name: Elven Magic
Elven Magic.description: • Elven Magic: Half-elves have an inherent connection to arcane energies. They get a free @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{reroll} when rolling to resist enemy powers.

Energy Drain.name: Energy Drain
Energy Drain.description:
With a successful touch or attack, a victim must make a resistance roll (usually with @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Vigor}) or lose a die type in the targeted attribute.

If the attack would reduce an attribute below d4, the victim is @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Incapacitated} until healed or he recovers a lost die type (see below). If the targeted attribute was Vigor, he must make a Vigor roll at the end of his next turn or perish.

Recovery: Unless slain, a victim recovers one die type every 24 hours, or if given respite with the Restoration modifier of @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Relief]{relief}.

Environmental Resistance.name: Environmental Resistance
Environmental Resistance.description:
The creature is resistant (but not immune) to a particular type of energy or matter such as cold, heat, electricity, cold iron, etc.

Damage from that source is reduced by 4, and the being adds +4 to resist matching @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{Hazards} and powers with a similar @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Trapping}.

Environmental Weakness.name: Environmental Weakness
Environmental Weakness.description:
The creature is susceptible to a particular type of energy or matter, such as cold, heat, electricity, cold iron, etc.

The creature takes +4 damage from that source, and subtracts 4 when resisting @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{Hazards} or powers with a similar @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Trapping}.

Ethereal.name: Ethereal
Ethereal.description:
Ghosts, shadows, will-o’-wisps, and similar intangible creatures have no form in the physical world (or can turn it on and off at will). They can pass through physical objects, cannot be harmed by non-magical attacks, and cannot even be seen unless they desire to be. Ethereal creatures are affected by magical items, weapons, and supernatural powers.

Unless its description says otherwise, ethereal creatures can throw objects, wield weapons, or even push terrified heroes down long, dark stairs.

Evocation (Favored).description:

Evocation magic taps into the unseen source of power to produce spectacular effects. @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Blast]{Blast}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Bolt]{bolt}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Burst]{burst}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Havoc]{havoc}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Light / Darkness]{light/darkness}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Stun]{stun}.
