@UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore05powers.JournalEntryPage.05schoolsofmag00]{See Schools of Magic for more}.

Travel.name: Travel
Travel.description:
• Aspects: Freedom, liberation, wanderlust
  • Deities: Abadar, Cayden Cailean, Desna
  • Available Powers: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Deflection]{Deflection}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Environmental Protection]{environmental protection}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Fly]{fly}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Intangibility]{intangibility}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Locate]{locate}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Plane Shift]{plane shift}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Scrying]{scrying}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Sloth/Speed]{sloth/speed}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Speak Language]{speak language}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Teleport]{teleport}.

Treat Wounds.name: Treat Wounds
Treat Wounds.description:
The @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Healing]{Healing} skill is used to remove @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03damageeffect00]{Wounds}. Each attempt requires 10 minutes per wound level of the patient. Subtract 1 from Healing rolls without a basic First Aid kit or similar supplies.

A success removes one Wound, and a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03traitrolls0000]{raise} removes two. Failure means no Wounds are removed. A @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03traitrolls0000]{Critical Failure} increases the victim’s Wound level by one.

The Golden Hour

Patients who survive their initial trauma have about an hour to survive most life-threatening injuries. If they receive medical attention during that time, they can generally be saved. The longer the wait, however, the more likely the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03damageeffect00]{Wounds} are to be fatal.

In Savage Worlds, we extend this concept to healing in general. Besides reflecting the real-world concept, it also provides good game balance and drama as the party has to decide whether to press on despite their injuries.

The Golden Hour: A character may only attempt to heal @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03damageeffect00]{Wounds} on a patient once within the hour they were sustained. Failing the roll means the healer isn’t able to treat those particular injuries. A different character may attempt a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Healing]{Healing} roll on the same patient, however.

Once the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03damageeffect00]{Wounds} are over an hour old, only natural healing or the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Healing]{healing} power (using greater healing) can heal Wounds.

Bleeding Out: The @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Healing]{Healing} skill can also be used to stabilize someone who’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03damageeffect00]{Bleeding Out}. Each attempt is an @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03actions0000000]{action}, and if successful the victim is stabilized.

Incapacitation: Healing at least one @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03damageeffect00]{Wound} on an @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03damageeffect00]{Incapacitated} patient removes that state (and restores consciousness if he was knocked out).

Trickery.name: Trickery
Trickery.description:
• Aspects: Chance, deception, secrets, stealth
  • Deities: Asmodeus, Calistria, Lamashtu, Norgorber
  • Available Powers: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Blind]{Blind}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Confusion]{confusion}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Deflection]{deflection}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Detect/Conceal Arcana]{detect/conceal arcana}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Disguise]{disguise}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Illusion]{illusion}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Invisibility]{invisibility}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Puppet]{puppet}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Speak Language]{speak language}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Time Stop]{time stop}.

Unarmed Strike.name: Unarmed Strike
Unarmed Strike.description:
Unarmed Strike: Monks gain +1 to Fighting attacks when attacking unarmed and AP +2. They cause Str+d4 damage with their hands, feet, or other @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Natural Weapons} (if they have such appendages).
If the monk already has a Strength damage die from Claws (available to some ancestries), or the Brawler Edge, increase the damage a die type for each.
Monks can apply the Trademark Weapon Edge to their unarmed attacks.
Monks always count as armed. Some use regular weapons in their off-hand, but abilities that refer to their Unarmed Strike apply only to unarmed attacks as defined above.
On a raise the monk rolls a d10 for his bonus damage.

Undead.name: Undead
Undead.description:
Zombies, skeletons, and similar physical horrors are particularly difficult to destroy. In most cases, undead creatures are Evil, but there are exceptions. Below are the benefits of being such an abomination.

  • Add +2 to Toughness and @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traitsummari00]{Spirit} rolls to recover from being @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Shaken}, ignore additional damage from @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Called Shots}, ignore 1 point of @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wound} penalties, don’t breathe or eat and are immune to @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{disease} and @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{poison}, don’t @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03healing0000000]{Bleed Out}, ignore penalties for @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03situationalr00]{Illumination} up to 10″, and can only be healed with magical @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Healing]{Healing}.

Undead (Bloodline).name: Undead (Bloodline)
Undead (Bloodline).description:
The taint of the grave runs through the character’s bloodline. She gains @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Environmental Resistance]{environmental resistance} to cold and a +1 to @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Soak rolls}.

  • Advanced Form: The sorcerer is truly undead. She gains the full @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Undead]{Undead} ability and the @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-hindrances.Outsider]{Outsider} (Major) and @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-hindrances.Ugly]{Ugly} (Major) Hindrance. The heroine might actually be attractive but she’s still disturbing to the living!

Undead (Type).name: Undead (Type)
Undead (Type).description: A once-living creature reanimated by magical or supernatural force.

Unstoppable.name: Unstoppable
Unstoppable.description: The creature has strong will, magical protections, or great mass. It takes a maximum of one Wound per attack no matter how many @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wounds} would normally be caused (after @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Soak rolls} are made). Certain Weaknesses or magic items ignore this ability, as does an attacker acting on a Joker.

Vermin (Type).name: Vermin (Type)
Vermin (Type).description: Living invertebrate creatures, from insects, to arachnids, and arthropods.

Very Resilient.name: Very Resilient
Very Resilient.description:
Some creatures, such as ogres or dire versions of common animals on Golarion, are tough to put down.

Resilient Extras can take one @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Wound} before they’re @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03combat00000000]{Incapacitated}, Very Resilient Extras can take two. @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Wild Cards} can’t be Resilient or Very Resilient. The abilities exist to bring select Extras a little closer to the heroes and villains who lead them.

Wall Walker.name: Wall Walker
Wall Walker.description: A wall walker’s movement rate when walking on walls is its standard @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Movement}. It may run as usual when walking on walls unless the specific creature’s text says otherwise.

War.name: War
War.description:
• Aspects: Battle, bravery, victory
  • Deities: Gorum, Iomedae, Rovagug, Urgathoa
  • Available Powers: @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Barrier]{Barrier}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Blast]{blast}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Blind]{blind}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Confusion]{confusion}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Deflection]{deflection}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Fear]{fear}, speed/sloth, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Stun]{stun}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Summon Ally]{summon ally}, @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-powers.Warrior's Gift]{warrior's gift}

Weakness.name: Weakness
Weakness.description: Some creatures can only be hurt by certain substances, are debilitated by sunlight or holy symbols, or might perish immediately if affected by some holy relic, rare object, or magical item. A Weakness not covered by @Compendium[swpf-core-rules.swpf-abilities.Environmental Weakness]{Environmental Weakness} is listed here along with the specific rules and conditions required to trigger it.

Wilderness Stride.name: Wilderness Stride
Wilderness Stride.description: Wilderness Stride: Rangers pass through rough terrain such as dense forest, rocky hills, or desert sands with ease. They ignore movement penalties for Difficult Ground (see @UUID[Compendium.swpf-core-rules.swpf-rules.swpfcore03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03rules000000000]{Movement}).
